SelectOrgan: Click on the scissors to cut the sympathetic nerve or fly over the mouse on an organ to read details.
LabDescription: The lab helps identify different organs (spinal cord, nerve and carotid sinus) involved in the nervous mechanism of activity of the heart. The influence of the section of the different nerves and their stimulation on the functioning of the heart.
Heart Role Explanation: This is the most obvious: the stronger the force of contraction of the heart, the more the pressure will increase in the arteries.
Sympathetic Nerve Role Explanation: Sympathetic nerves interfere in the mechanism of regulation of arterial pressure.
ParaSympathetic Nerve Role Explanation: Parasympathetic nerves interfere in the mechanism of regulation of arterial pressure as Sympathetic ones.
Carotid Sinus Role Explanation: The carotid sinus contains receptors sensitive to any variation in blood pressure of baroreceptors.
Hering Nerve Role Explanation: The Hering nerve, like that of Cyon, interferes with the mechanism of blood pressure regulation.
